intro: Neoboivinella natalensis, commonly known as Natal's boivinella, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Rhamnaceae and is characterized by its small, simple leaves and clusters of small, yellowish-green flowers. The plant typically grows in shrubland and rocky habitats, thriving in well-drained soils. It is a relatively small shrub, usually reaching heights of less than one meter. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endemic species.
